# Accredited research status {#sec-access-accredited-researcher}

To access ECHILD researchers must become fully 
[Accredited Researchers](https://www.ons.gov.uk/aboutus/whatwedo/statistics/requestingstatistics/secureresearchservice/becomeanaccreditedresearcher) 
under the Digital Economy Act 2017 (DEA) as this enables researchers to carry 
out analysis and produce outputs on projects within a Trusted Research 
Environment such as the ONS Secure Research Service (SRS). To be a fully 
accredited researcher, individuals must have an undergraduate degree 
(or higher), including a significant proportion of maths or statistics. 
Otherwise, they must be able to demonstrate at least three years of 
quantitative research experience.[42]
